channel.title: Change color of text in a client
channel.description: how do i change text on a client, like when you talk the words are pink, and i want to make them normal color, blue i think it was. how do i do it please help?

item.title: Change color of text in a client
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:6, topic:193451”]It has something to do with method385.[/quote]Make up your mind?

client.method77(String a, int b, String c, boolean d)
That is pretty much like sendMessage() serverside.
Leave a null, b will be called “color identifier”, c is the text you want displayed like sendMessage(), and keep d as false.

Now, go to method18(int) in the client class.
Above:

                    if(l == 8 && (anInt1248 == 0 || anInt1248 == 1 && method109(false, s1))) {
                        if(i1 > 0 && i1 < 110)
                            class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0x7e3200, s1 + " " + aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, 4);
                        j++;
                    }

Add something like this:

                  if(l == 80) 
                  { 
                        if(i1 > 0 && i1 < 110) 
	                { 
	                        class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(0x800000, s1 + " " + aStringArray944[k], i1, 822, 4); 
	                 } 
	                 j++; 
	           }

Look at the if(l == 80) part. Change 80 to your color identifier we talked about earlier. Now, everytime you send a message with method77(), it will check for ‘color’ in method18(). To change the color, change the 0x800000 part in the code above.

EDIT: Just realized, instead of all the above to have colored messages client-side, you can simply do this:

class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(COLOR_CODE, String MSG, int MSG_LENGTH, 822, 4);

For your color codes, use http://www.drewfoster.com/rgbhex/images/rgbhex.gif
And add a 0x before the color code you want to use.

Now to get the color to work by using sendMessage() server side, simply add something to the end of the message like “:color”.

Now find this in the client class:

                if(s.endsWith(":tradereq:"))
                {
                    String s3 = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(":"));
                    long l17 = Class50.method583(s3);
                    boolean flag2 = false;
                    for(int j27 = 0; j27 < anInt822; j27++)
                    {
                        if(aLongArray925[j27] != l17)
                            continue;
                        flag2 = true;
                        break;
                    }

                    if(!flag2 && anInt1251 == 0)
                        method77("wishes to trade with you.", 4, s3, aBoolean991);
                }

Above it, put something like:

                if(s.endsWith(":color"))
                {
                    String s3 = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(":"));
                    long l17 = Class50.method583(s3);
                    boolean flag9 = false;
                    for(int j27 = 0; j27 < anInt822; j27++)
                    {
                        if(aLongArray925[j27] != l17)
                            continue;
                        flag9 = true;
                        break;
                    }

                    if(!flag9 && anInt1251 == 0)
                        method77(" ", 80, s3, aBoolean991);
	} else

You can change whatever you want from “:color” thats just my example. Look towards the bottom of that last code, it calls method77. See number 80? Thats our color identifier. This way, when you send a message from the server and the client reads it, if it ends with “:color”, it will make the message display with color.

EDIT: Corresponding to my last edit, instead of all the above, you can do:

if(s.endsWith(":color"))
{
       class30_sub2_sub1_sub4.method385(COLOR_CODE, String MSG, int MSG_LENGTH, 822, 4); 
}

Enjoy.
P.S. This is an old way of doing it from a while back. Found it out when I made clan chat. Works though.

Read full topic
